message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.CL, cs.IR. 

The paper discusses a system that processes daily trending topics on Twitter and assigns a controversy score to each topic based on interactions among users. This involves natural language processing (NLP) to analyze the messages (tweets) associated with each topic, as well as social network analysis (SNA) to understand how controversy is manifested in social interactions. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SD (Software Engineering), which both involve SNA and NLP. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) to sort and explore topics by different criteria, which suggests cs.CL (Computation and Language) as another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on understanding controversial topics in social media suggests cs.SOC (Computers and Society) as a possible sub-category.
